helpdesk_ticket.description:
To

PharmEasy Customer Support / Diagnostic Escalation Team



This is to register a serious complaint regarding my lab test order #6226021.



Today, your technician Mahesh S Ballary collected my sample at 10:00 AM, well before the assigned slot of 10:30 AM–11:30 AM.

However, even after collecting the sample, he did NOT update the sample collection status in the PharmEasy app and gave the excuse of “server is low.”



Due to this failure, your system has now sent me a message saying my appointment is rescheduled, even though the sample is already taken.

This is completely unacceptable, and it puts the integrity of my test at risk.



This situation clearly shows:



? Failure to scan and log my sample barcode

? Incorrect appointment status even after sample collection

? No real-time update from the technician

? High risk of report delay or rejection

? Operational failure covered up by saying “server is low”



Your customer care has only verbally confirmed that the sample is collected, but your system still shows a wrong reschedule status, which means:



⚠️ My sample might not be logged in the lab

⚠️ The report may not start processing on time

⚠️ The sample can get delayed or rejected due to improper barcode syncing

⚠️ There is no official confirmation of collection in the app



I am demanding the following immediately:



1️⃣ Manually update my order status to “Sample Collected.”

2️⃣ Confirm that my sample has been scanned, logged, and sent to the lab.

3️⃣ Verify barcode registration and provide proof.

4️⃣ Ensure my report TAT remains as per the original schedule.

5️⃣ Take strict action against the technician for not updating the collection in the app.



Please treat this as a high-priority escalation and provide a written confirmation of the above, as this issue directly affects my diagnostic report and health.





Dr Akshata Valandikar 


--

helpdesk_ticket.subject: ⚠️ URGENT ESCALATION – WRONG STATUS UPDATE AFTER SAMPLE COLLECTION ⚠️
helpdesk_ticket.description_html:
To
PharmEasy Customer Support / Diagnostic Escalation Team

This is to register a serious complaint regarding my lab test order #6226021.

Today, your technician Mahesh S Ballary collected my sample at 10:00 AM, well before the assigned slot of 10:30 AM–11:30 AM.
However, even after collecting the sample, he did NOT update the sample collection status in the PharmEasy app and gave the excuse of “server is low.”

Due to this failure, your system has now sent me a message saying my appointment is rescheduled, even though the sample is already taken.
This is completely unacceptable, and it puts the integrity of my test at risk.

This situation clearly shows:

🔴 Failure to scan and log my sample barcode
🔴 Incorrect appointment status even after sample collection
🔴 No real-time update from the technician
🔴 High risk of report delay or rejection
🔴 Operational failure covered up by saying “server is low”

Your customer care has only verbally confirmed that the sample is collected, but your system still shows a wrong reschedule status, which means:

⚠️ My sample might not be logged in the lab
⚠️ The report may not start processing on time
⚠️ The sample can get delayed or rejected due to improper barcode syncing
⚠️ There is no official confirmation of collection in the app

I am demanding the following immediately:

1️⃣ Manually update my order status to “Sample Collected.”
2️⃣ Confirm that my sample has been scanned, logged, and sent to the lab.
3️⃣ Verify barcode registration and provide proof.
4️⃣ Ensure my report TAT remains as per the original schedule.
5️⃣ Take strict action against the technician for not updating the collection in the app.

Please treat this as a high-priority escalation and provide a written confirmation of the above, as this issue directly affects my diagnostic report and health.




Dr Akshata Valandikar

Dear Nidhiji and Swwarupaji

I'm writing to bring to your attention the issue with my order from your pharmeasy. I mistakenly ordered 50 strips (3 packs) instead of 25 strips (3 packs) and want to return 2 packs of 50 strips. The pharmeasy is rejecting my return request, citing non-returnable item, but there's no such marking on the order while placing the order on website.

The item is Dr Morphy Richards Diaper strip, and I've requested return on the same day within hours of delivery. But still they insisted it's non returnable item.

Please support me in resolving this issue. 

Order Details:
- Order no 650920138618474496.
- Product: Dr Morphy Richards Diaper strip
- Quantity: 50 strips (3 packs)

Awaiting your support 

Best regards,
Rakesh Gandhi

Hello Simran,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

With regards to your order #650920138618474496-41473, as checked the return request is already raised for medicine from your order. As per the records, the medicines are picked up on 07 December 2025.

As the medicine has been  returned, it will be verified by our partner retailer at the store. The refund will be processed and initiated within 48 business hours. Also, once the refund is initiated it would reflect in your orignial account within 7-10 business days. 

We appreciate your patience in the meantime.

We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.

For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels, on the App or website, listed in the "Need Help" section.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!

Regards,
PharmEasy

helpdesk_ticket.subject: Endorsed by EFIC: Join The Med-Cannabis2026 Congress in Kraków, Poland
helpdesk_ticket.description_html:
View this email in your browser
 
Dear Colleagues and Friends,​

It is our pleasure to invite you to participate in The 6th International Annual Congress on Controversies on Cannabis-Based Medicines (Med-Cannabis2026) which will take place 9-10 March 2026 in Kraków, Poland.

Register here
Submit Abstract
 
 
Med-Cannabis2026 will address the many controversies surrounding cannabis-based medicines. Strong public and patient demand have led to the decision to allow cannabis products for medical use in most European countries.
 
There is a lot of basic-science and clinical research on the potential use of cannabis products for chronic pain and cancer management as well as controversies on the potential harms.
 
This Congress will bring together physicians, researchers, clinicians, trialists, methodologists, industry professionals and national cannabis agencies to update the current state of knowledge and of controversies and to outline some visions of the potential of cannabis-based medicines.
 
The program will include a wealth of knowledge from our world-renowned panel of experts.
 
We look forward to seeing you at Med-Cannabis2026 in the historic and charming city of Kraków.

Sincerely,
 
Dr. Silviu Brill
Congress Co-Chair
 
Prof. Katarzyna Starowicz
Congress Co-Chair

 
 
Tel    | + 44-203-051-4032
 
Unsubscribe  | Spam report
Sent with ActiveTrail software

Hello Parmeet Singh,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

With regards to your order #654577111309983744-62973, as checked due to some unforeseen circumstances, the order was not delivered to you by the expected date of delivery. Please accept my apologies for the same.

As per the records, your order is delivered to you on 04th December 2025. We have jotted down the details of your experience and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future.

We look forward to having an opportunity to serve you in the future.

We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.

For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section. 

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!

Regards,
PharmEasy

notes.body: Hello Abhinandan,      Greetings from PharmEasy!     I understand your concern in regard to genuine medicines. I will surely assist you with this.     I wish to inform you that our Partner Retailers are government-accredited and authorised business owners who provide 100% Genuine medicines. We take the utmost care in selecting our Partner Retailers and maintain strict quality controls so that you always get standard quality products.     We maintain strict quality controls on all our partner retailers so that you always get standard quality products. We take utmost care in selecting our channel partners, and they, in turn, procure directly from the manufacturers/distributors.      Apart from this, every product is checked internally (sealing, manufacturing, and expiry date) before any shipment is dispatched. Product manufacturing and expiry details are available on every product as well.     Kindly share the images of that product with the PharmEasy barcode (white QR sticker) and the batch number (MRP details) for further action.     Awaiting your response.     Regards,  Sandhya Nackwal

notes.body: Hello Abhinandan,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     This email is in regards to order #642363997049704448-82348.     We tried calling you today, however, were unable to connect with you. As per the update received, we can raise a return request for the item KETOALFA STRIP OF 10 TABLETS . However, if we raise the return request, the refund will be credited to your PharmEasy wallet.     If you do not wish to have the refund in the PharmEasy wallet for return requests, you can set refund preferences in your App or on the website based on the Mode of Payment that you select for your orders:  1. To set this up in the App, update the App to the most recent version. Click on the Account Icon below. Click on “Set Refund Preferences”. Select the mode of refund that you prefer.  2. To set this up on the website, click on the Account Icon with your name and select “My Profile”. In the menu on the left, go to “Profile Settings” and click on Manage Refunds. Select the mode of refund that you prefer.  3. If payments are received from the PharmEasy wallet and another source, any refunds will be credited to the PharmEasy wallet first and then to the second source.     Please confirm if we can raise a return request with PharmEasy wallet as the refund mode. Please also be informed that the item(s) that are opened, partially used, or disfigured are not eligible for returns. Items being returned should be in their original manufacturer’s packaging with labels and bar code intact.      You can call us on 7666 100 300 to avoid any delay.     Regards,  PharmEasy

helpdesk_ticket.subject: Submit Your Abstract for / AI for Clinical Applications, 11-12 March, 2026 in Brussels
helpdesk_ticket.description_html:
View this email in your browser
 
Dear Friends and Colleagues,

It is our pleasure to welcome you all to The European Conference on AI for Clinical Applications (Euraica2026) which will take place in Brussels, Belgium on 11 – 12 March, 2026.
 
Abstract Submission is Open
Submit your Abstract
View Our Program
Register Today & Save
 
This conference will explore how Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming the landscape of clinical research. From early protocol design to post-trial evidence generation, AI technologies are accelerating timelines, enhancing decision-making, and improving trial efficiency. By leveraging real-world data (RWD), predictive models, and automation tools, AI is driving a more adaptive, patient-centered, and evidence-driven R&D process.
 
At the same time, these innovations raise new methodological, regulatory, and ethical questions that deserve collective attention.
 
We are proud to bring together leading voices from clinical research, AI technologies, and regulatory science to deliver both visionary and practical insights.
 
The conference program will span a wide range of topics—from designing and running smarter trials with AI, to delivering meaningful, scalable evidence generation, and tackling emerging challenges at the intersection of innovation and regulation.
 
This event is a unique opportunity to engage with academic researchers, regulatory authorities, HTA representatives, investors, entrepreneurs, and executive leaders from pharmaceutical and biotech companies involved in clinical development, medical affairs, and regulatory strategy.
 
We also invite you to join us as a Sponsor or Exhibitor, and benefit from exceptional visibility and access to a forward-looking, cross-sector audience.
 
We look forward to welcoming you to Brussels for The European Conference on AI for Clinical Applications — and to shaping the future of clinical research together.
 
 
Tel    | + 44-203-051-4032
 
Unsubscribe  | Spam report
Sent with ActiveTrail software

As per the update, your order has been delivered delivered to you. Please accept my sincere apology for the inconvenience caused to you. The other big news is Vladimir Putin’s two-day visit to India, starting tomorrow. We’ll be covering this extensively, looking back at the country’s historic ties with Russia and giving you an insight into what to expect in the future.

helpdesk_ticket.description_html:
View in browser
The News Explained
03, Dec 2025
Hello, readers,

If you are doomscrolling, it’s time to stop and pay attention. What’s happening in the world around you? And how does it impact you? The Firstpost newsletter, “The News Explained”, has you covered.

Let’s talk about the Indian rupee. Yes, it’s sliding. Today, it slipped past the crucial 90-per-dollar level for the first time. How does it affect Indians? We explain.

The other big news is Vladimir Putin’s two-day visit to India, starting tomorrow. We’ll be covering this extensively, looking back at the country’s historic ties with Russia and giving you an insight into what to expect in the future.

Today’s edition also covers the rising tensions between the US and Venezuela and tells you the story of “Little Einstein”.
1

Why has the rupee hit a record low? What does it mean for Indians?

On Wednesday, the rupee for the first time ever crossed the Rs 90-mark against the dollar. This comes after the currency, which touched 90.13, closed at Rs 89.95 on Tuesday and Rs 89.53 on Monday. While the rupee has been one of Asia’s worst-performing currencies against the greenback in 2025, the fall of this psychologically important barrier left many concerned about what happens next
Read Full Article
2

Trade, defence deals and labour pacts… What Vladimir Putin’s India visit is all about

When Vladimir Putin comes to India on December 4, it won’t be a regular, routine trip by a world leader. The Russian leader’s two-day visit will go beyond routine diplomacy, focusing on trade, defence deals, and jobs. When Putin meets Prime Minister Modi, they are likely to discuss Donald Trump and the pressure on New Delhi to downgrade ties with Moscow
Read Full Article
3

When Russia helped India in the war against Pakistan in 1971

Russian President Vladimir Putin’s upcoming State visit has put the spotlight on the foundations of India-Russia ties, rooted in the Soviet Union’s decisive role during the 1971 Indo-Pak war. As New Delhi and Moscow prepare for a major summit, the strategic interventions that shaped Bangladesh’s creation are back under the lens
Read Full Article
4

Who is US Navy Admiral Bradley, Pentagon scapegoat for second strike on Venezuelan drug boat?

US Navy Admiral Frank M Bradley’s role in the second strike on a burning vessel near Trinidad and Tobago has resulted in a firestorm in Washington. After two survivors were killed in the follow-up attack, congressional committees, the Pentagon, and the White House are now clashing over accountability
Read Full Article
5

Meet Laurent Simons, the ‘Little Einstein’ who has completed his PhD in quantum physics at 15

Laurent Simons, a 15-year-old prodigy, has completed his PhD in quantum physics from Belgium's University of Antwerp, in what could be a record time. The teen, who completed his bachelor's degree in physics by the age of 12, reportedly has an IQ of 145, a range achieved by only about 0.1 per cent of the population
Read Full Article

helpdesk_ticket.description:
Webinar on

Export Incentives

wrt FTP

on

10th December 2025

02:00 PM to 05:00 PM

By

Mr. K Rajasekaran

Corporate Trainer and Ex-Banker SBI


Introduction:

The FTP 2023 has introduced initiatives to promote exports and facilitate
trade in India. These include rationalizing export performance thresholds
for recognition of exporters as status holders, allowing merchanting trade
involving shipment of goods from one foreign country to another, accepting
rupee payments under FTP schemes, and declaring four new towns of export
excellence.

These initiatives will reduce transaction costs and enable more exporters to
achieve higher status, ultimately promoting international trade and economic
growth.

Objective:

The objective of this program is to acquaint the participants with nuances
of existing as well as emerging export incentives and their impact on Export
Pricing. It will lead to making their export business more lucrative,
profitable by enabling them to compete Internationally.

For Whom:

The program would be of use and interest to all those who are into export
business, prospective exporters and export professionals, besides
International Marketers.

 

Contents

* Facilitation under the Advance Authorization Scheme (AAS)

*  Features of Advance Authorisation Scheme

*  Duty-free import of raw materials for manufacturing export items.

 

* Facilitation under the Export Promotion of Capital Goods (EPCG) Scheme

*  Features of EPCG Scheme

*  Import of capital goods at zero Customs duty for export production, is
being further rationalized

*  Green Technology products - will now be eligible for reduced Export
Obligation requirements under EPCG Scheme

 

* Special one-time Amnesty Scheme under which Exporters who have been unable
to meet their obligations under EPCG and Advance Authorizations can be
regularised on payment of all customs duties exempted in proportion to
unfulfilled export obligations.

 

* Continuance of existing schemes: Duty Draw Back

 

* RoDTEP Scheme - Features

*  Refund of Embedded Duties and Taxes

*  Procedural Compliance

*  Registration on ICEGATE website

*  Issue of E-Scrips under RoTDEP schemes

* Rates & Entitlement


Profile of Faculty

Mr. K. Rajasekaran

Corporate Trainer and Ex-Banker SBI

Mr. K Rajasekaran is a Corporate Trainer and Visiting Faculty in banking and
finance. He has more than 20 years of experience in banking and over 10
years of experience in teaching and training. He has been a Sr Executive
with State Bank of Travancore (since merged with SBI) and Global Trust Bank.

He has long experience in Corporate/ SME banking, Trade Finance, Forex and
banking operations. He has been regularly conducting training programs on
Export Import Procedures and Documentation, Inco Terms, Letters of Credit
/UCP 600 and INCOTERMS 2020, RBI Guidelines / FEMA Regulations for
export/import, Trade Finance for Exporters and Importers, Finance for
Non-Finance Managers and many more.

Representatives have attended his programs from corporates like Hindustan
Aeronautics / Bharat Electronics/Caterpillar/ Mangalore Refineries / Adani
Power / Gujarat Ambuja Exports / Chennai Petroleum Corporation etc.

He is B.com, C.A.I.I.B. and currently he is a visiting faculty at Ahmedabad
Management Association, ISBR Business School, Bangalore and Chennai
Management Academy.


Pre-requisites

You should have good internet connection and good quality headphone/speaker
set with Laptop / Desktop.

You should have notepad/pen to note down important points.


How To Register


Fee Structure: - Per participant

Rs. 5000/-

USD 91

----18% GST is applicable

> Fees include certificate of participation & Course Material.

*Terms & Conditions apply

 

Best regards

For GFORD Institute of Management Pvt Ltd

Kapil Sharma

For Booking seats Email us : gfordseminar@outlook.com 

Mob. : 9711114779 / 9315556407

For Query and nominations - 9540012349 only Whatsapp

For unsubscribe from the mailing list, please mail us on
gfordremoving@gmail.com

 

 


-- 


Disclaimer:

This email contains proprietary, business-confidential, 
and/or privileged material. The information contained in this e-mail is 
intended solely for the use of the individual to whom it is addressed. If 
you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any 
disclosure, copying, distribution or action in relation to the contents of 
this email is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful and request you to 
permanently delete this message and any attachments herein. You are
